Subjective: Right low back pain x 1.5 weeks, progressively worsening. Radiates down posterior right thigh and lateral right lower leg to foot. Constant pain, all day. Associated tingling and dull sensation on the outside of the right lower leg. Pain prevents sleep; awake for nights. Unable to work (supermarket, involves heavy lifting). Tried paracetamol and ibuprofen max doses with no relief. No subjective weakness. Pertinent Negatives: No change in strength, normal sensation in perineal ("riding breeches") area, no problems with urination or defecation. Social: Works in a supermarket, currently off work due to pain. Concern: Neighbor had similar issue and needed surgery. Request: Asks about need for CT/MRI scan and surgery.
Objective: General: Appears in pain, especially with movement (e.g., getting on exam bench). Back Exam: No visible abnormalities. No vertebral tenderness on palpation. Neurological Exam (Lower Limbs): Sensation: Decreased/dull sensation on right leg/foot compared to left. Motor: Strength 5/5 bilaterally in all tested groups (hip flexion, knee extension/flexion, ankle dorsiflexion/plantarflexion), though movement is painful. Reflexes: Symmetrical and normal. Special Tests: Straight leg raise positive on the right (reproduces radicular pain); negative on the left.
Assessment: Suspected lumbar disc herniation with right-sided radiculopathy. No red flag signs for cauda equina syndrome.
Plan: Explained diagnosis: suspected nerve compression from an intervertebral disc (hernia).
Start Pregabalin for neuropathic pain; counselled on slow dose titration and side effects.
Advised no driving for at least 1 week after starting or changing dose of Pregabalin.
Recommend physiotherapy for exercises and back flexibility.
Explained that scans and surgery are not first-line; conservative management is preferred.
Safety Netting: Return immediately for new/worsening perineal numbness ('riding breeches' area), loss of bowel/bladder control, or significant leg weakness.
Follow-up: Telephone appointment in 1 week to review pain control and medication side effects.
